body_html:
@princebhatia09 It has a good public hosting service. It sounds weird that you download packages from Google Drive and then install it.
@Neltherion You can try first installing pytables then pytorch. If you still get the error, install the offline package from Anaconda.

And thanks for what you've done with the port... the main developers really don't seem to care for Windows...

Actually, they care for this. The Windows PRs are actively merged. The official Windows CI is near to be setup, and the official package is planned for 0.4.0.
